head.title: SO FRENCH, IT MUST BE FROM CALIFORNIA

hedline.hl1: SO FRENCH, IT MUST BE FROM CALIFORNIA

abstract.p: Barbara Barry, Los Angeles furniture designer, exhibits new additions to her Southern California neo-traditional style furniture at Baker, Knapp & Tubbs furniture showroom in Manhattan (Currents); photos (S)

block.p: Barbara Barry, the Los Angeles furniture designer, is known for a Southern California neo-traditional style. Much of her collection has a spare elegance, with fluted carving; her upholstery is often in creamy parchment colors or in leather with oversize nailheads. She credits 1930's French designers like Jules Leleu and Jean-Michel Frank for her inspiration.

Barbara Barry, the Los Angeles furniture designer, is known for a Southern California neo-traditional style. Much of her collection has a spare elegance, with fluted carving; her upholstery is often in creamy parchment colors or in leather with oversize nailheads. She credits 1930's French designers like Jules Leleu and Jean-Michel Frank for her inspiration.

For the reopening last week of the expanded and renovated Baker, Knapp & Tubbs furniture showroom at 200 Lexington Avenue (32d Street), Ms. Barry, below, presented several additions to her collection. The chicly tailored Oval-Back armchair (in watercolor, above) costs from $1,826 to $2,250.
